content.title: Radial Artery Anatomy
content.description: Lateral terminal branch of the brachial artery, running along the lateral aspect of forearm to wrist where it contributes to palmar arches.
content.origin: Brachial artery bifurcation in cubital fossa

course.forearm: Deep to brachioradialis, becomes superficial distally

relations.superficial_radial_nerve: Lateral to artery in middle forearm

clinical_applications.pulse_palpation: Easily felt at distal radius (standard pulse check)
clinical_applications.arterial_line: Common site for invasive BP monitoring
clinical_applications.coronary_bypass: Harvested as conduit (second choice after LIMA)
clinical_applications.transradial_access: Preferred site for coronary and peripheral intervention

content.allen_test: Assessment of dual hand circulation via radial and ulnar supply before radial artery harvest or access
